  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Finance Officer",
  "description": "Contec Global Group - Established in 1984 and headquartered in London, the Contec Global Group has a worldwide presence, with operations in Asia, Africa, and Europe. As a company established on the platform of e-Governance and smart technologies, Contec Global is among the most experienced independent technology and systems organizations operating in developing countries. Today, the Group is engaged, globally, in providing integrated, systems-based solutions in the fields of Secure Technologies, Infrastructure, and Hospitality

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Finance Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Arepo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Finance Officer will oversee day-to-day financial transactions, maintain accurate accounting records, and support financial planning activities within a CNG operations environment.
	The role requires strong familiarity with financial systems, with experience in ERP platforms and Tally software as an added advantage. Candidates should be detail-oriented, analytical, and able to work effectively in a fast-paced industrial setting.


Key Responsibilitie
Financial Accounting &amp; Reporting:


	Maintain up-to-date financial records, ledgers, and reconciliations using ERP/Tally.
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly financial reports for management.
	Track revenue from CNG sales, station transactions, customer accounts, and operational expenses.
	Support budgeting and financial forecasting for CNG operations and projects.
	Conduct timely bank reconciliations and monitor cash flow.


Accounts Payable &amp; Receivable:


	Process supplier invoices, customer payments, and staff expense requests.
	Ensure accurate billing for CNG customers and proper reconciliation of meters, POS, and cash sales.
	Follow up on outstanding receivables and ensure timely settlements.
	Maintain documentation for all payables and receivables.


Cost &amp; Inventory Support (CNG Operations):


	Monitor and track CNG-related costs (compression, logistics, maintenance, utilities).
	Assist in verifying station inventories, meter readings, and daily sales summaries.
	Work closely with operations to reconcile product movement and usage.


Compliance &amp; Internal Controls:


	Ensure adherence to financial policies, statutory requirements, and audit standards.
	Support internal/external audit processes with accurate documentation.
	Implement strong internal controls to safeguard company assets and reduce financial risks.


ERP &amp; Tally Functions:


	Post transactions, generate reports, and manage financial data through ERP software.
	Utilize Tally for bookkeeping, reconciliation, and basic accounting tasks (advantage).
	Provide input on improving financial workflows through digital tools.


Requirements &amp; Qualifications


	B.Sc./HND in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	2&ndash;4 years of relevant experience, preferably in oil &amp; gas, energy, or industrial operations.
	Experience with ERP systems; working knowledge of Tally is an added advantage.
	Strong understanding of accounting principles and financial analysis.
	Excellent proficiency in Excel and financial reporting tools.
	Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and problem-solving skills.
	Must reside in or around Arepo, Ogun State.

Finance Officer Job at Contec Global Group




        
    

        
        Contec Global Group - Established in 1984 and headquartered in London, the Contec Global Group has a worldwide presence, with operations in Asia, Africa, and Europe. As a company established on the platform of e-Governance and smart technologies, Contec Global is among the most experienced independent technology and systems organizations operating in developing countries. We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Officer

Job Location: Arepo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Finance Officer will oversee day-to-day financial transactions, maintain accurate accounting records, and support financial planning activities within a CNG operations environment.
	The role requires strong familiarity with financial systems, with experience in ERP platforms and Tally software as an added advantage. Candidates should be detail-oriented, analytical, and able to work effectively in a fast-paced industrial setting.


Key Responsibilitie
Financial Accounting & Reporting:


	Maintain up-to-date financial records, ledgers, and reconciliations using ERP/Tally.
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly financial reports for management.
	Track revenue from CNG sales, station transactions, customer accounts, and operational expenses.
	Support budgeting and financial forecasting for CNG operations and projects.
	Conduct timely bank reconciliations and monitor cash flow.


Accounts Payable & Receivable:


	Process supplier invoices, customer payments, and staff expense requests.
	Ensure accurate billing for CNG customers and proper reconciliation of meters, POS, and cash sales.
	Follow up on outstanding receivables and ensure timely settlements.
	Maintain documentation for all payables and receivables.


Cost & Inventory Support (CNG Operations):


	Monitor and track CNG-related costs (compression, logistics, maintenance, utilities).
	Assist in verifying station inventories, meter readings, and daily sales summaries.
	Work closely with operations to reconcile product movement and usage.


Compliance & Internal Controls:


	Ensure adherence to financial policies, statutory requirements, and audit standards.
	Support internal/external audit processes with accurate documentation.
	Implement strong internal controls to safeguard company assets and reduce financial risks.


ERP & Tally Functions:


	Post transactions, generate reports, and manage financial data through ERP software.
	Utilize Tally for bookkeeping, reconciliation, and basic accounting tasks (advantage).
	Provide input on improving financial workflows through digital tools.


Requirements & Qualifications


	B.Sc./HND in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	2–4 years of relevant experience, preferably in oil & gas, energy, or industrial operations.
	Experience with ERP systems; working knowledge of Tally is an added advantage.
	Strong understanding of accounting principles and financial analysis.
	Excellent proficiency in Excel and financial reporting tools.
	Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and problem-solving skills.
	Must reside in or around Arepo, Ogun State.
